abstract: Moody’s Investors Service will decide on banks’ credit ratings in mid-May, and Morgan Stanley, Bank of America and Citigroup could be cut to a level just two notches above speculative grade.
snippet: Moody’s Investors Service will decide on banks’ credit ratings in mid-May, and Morgan Stanley, Bank of America and Citigroup could be cut to a level just two notches above speculative grade.
lead_paragraph: Some of Wall Street’s biggest banks are bracing for fallout from a possible cut in their credit ratings.

headline.main: Three Major Banks Prepare for Possible Credit Downgrades

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies

byline.original: By Susanne Craig and Peter Eavis
